article_title: A Terrorism That Dare Not Speak Its Name
article_text:
Only in the last paragraph of his review does Walter Russell Mead gently suggest that the entire thesis of Peter Bergen’s book “United States of Jihad” may be dangerously misguided (Bookshelf, Feb. 2).

Mr. Mead tells us that Peter Bergen, CNN’s national security analyst, agrees with the Obama administration’s thinking about homegrown terrorism, which plays down the role of radical theo-political ideology (Islamism) in spawning terrorist acts and focuses instead on such factors as financial turmoil and mental illness that...
